<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/extra-unemployment-benefits-kept-workers-sidelines-not-reduce-overall-employment-report-says?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Happens When the Benefits Expire
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/extra-unemployment-benefits-kept-workers-sidelines-not-reduce-overall-employment-report-says?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="unemployment" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NjcvdXNhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In March, the US government provided an additional $300/week to unemployed workers through September to blunt the impact of the economic downturn. Many states chose to end those benefits this summer, arguing they were a major contributor to the widespread labor shortage.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Did cutting those benefits boost hiring? </strong>Economists are scrambling to figure it out, and yesterday we got a <a href="https://gusto.com/company-news/hiring-trends-as-enhanced-unemployment-insurance-benefits-expire-evidence-from-high-frequency-small-business-data?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preliminary answer</a> that’s just as nuanced as the question: Extra unemployment insurance (UI) didn’t impact overall job growth, but it did cause a reshuffling of the type of people who were working. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That comes from a report from the payroll processor Gusto, which compared hiring trends in the 20 states that cut the extra unemployment (UI) payments in June with those in states that kept them around for longer.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The takeaways</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In states that ended extra UI early, hiring for adult workers 25 or older increased the week governors </span><span><em>said</em></span><span> they were cutting benefits, but it returned to typical levels once the benefits actually expired.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At the same time, the hiring of teenagers 15–19 jumped in states that didn’t cut the extra benefits.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Overall, employment growth in states that ended enhanced UI early </span><span><em>and</em></span><span> states that are keeping it until September has been roughly equal. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does it mean?</strong> Extra UI payments <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/07/27/unemployment-insurance-go-away/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">played a role</a> in keeping some adult workers from coming back to work. The spike in teen hiring in states with extra UI shows that when employers couldn’t find adults to hire, they brought on younger workers with less experience—and who may not qualify for unemployment.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The takeaway of the takeaways </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because overall employment growth didn’t change based on whether a state had cut off the extra benefits, “Ending unemployment insurance is not the silver bullet” to a speedier economic recovery, Gusto Economist Luke Pardue said. He suggested that alleviating childcare burdens and getting more people vaccinated were the keys to unlocking greater job growth.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/28/big-tech-companies-crush-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Breaking: Big Tech Is Big
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple, Microsoft, and Google approached analysts’ expectations the way Joey Chestnut approaches a plate of three hot dogs. Here’s a rundown of the earnings demolition in 130 words.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Apple, </strong>the world’s most valuable public company, said profits <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/27/apple-aapl-earnings-q3-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly doubled</a> last quarter, iPhone sales jumped an impressive 50%, and revenue for every major product line grew at least 12% annually. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Microsoft </strong>had its <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/27/technology/microsoft-q4-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most profitable quarter ever</a> thanks to greater demand for its cloud-computing services and workplace software. CEO Satya Nadella said the words “enterprise metaverse” on the earnings call and not even he knew what it meant. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Alphabet, </strong>Google’s parent company, said ad revenue <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/27/alphabet-googl-earnings-q2-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 69%</a> [redacted joke]. The real highlight was YouTube—with $7 billion in quarterly revenue it’s oh so close to eclipsing Netflix’s sales numbers ($7.3 billion).</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/simone-biles-withdraws-team-finals-take-care-mental-health?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Even GOATs Are Human
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/simone-biles-withdraws-team-finals-take-care-mental-health?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOKYO, JAPAN - JULY 27: Simone Biles of Team United States looks on duri..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTMzL2d5bW5hc3RpY3NfLV9hcnRpc3RpY18tX28uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Fred Lee/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simone Biles, US Olympic gymnastics team member and the greatest gymnast of all time, pulled out of the team finals in Tokyo yesterday, saying she wasn't in the right state of mind and feared she'd "do something dumb and get hurt." In a post-competition press conference, she <a href="https://www.huffpost.com/entry/simone-biles-naomi-osaka-mental-health-olympics_n_61001bdae4b00fa7af7c385b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> reporters that she was inspired to prioritize her mental health by Naomi Osaka’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/naomi-osaka-highestearning-female-athlete-world-drops-french-open?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">withdrawal</a> from the French Open this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened:</strong> After a rocky vault routine, the 24-year-old, four-time Olympic gold medalist left the floor, and teammate Jordan Chiles subbed in on the uneven bars. Team USA ultimately took silver.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Monday, Biles </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CRxsq_kBZrP/?utm_source=ig_embed&ig_rid=57417737-e4cc-4a93-a875-4f21c7ff8570" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a></span><span> on Instagram that sometimes it feels like she has the “weight of the world” on her shoulders.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Biles's decision is part of a larger trend of athletes, especially in this year’s Olympics, <a href="https://time.com/6082203/tokyo-olympics-mental-health/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opening up</a> about the emotional struggles that come with intense competition and scrutiny. This year’s Games mark the first time the Olympics introduced guidelines for athletes and coaches on how to screen for and address mental health concerns. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Biles said she wasn’t sure whether she’d compete in the individual competition that begins Thursday.</p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/key-performance-indicators-july-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Just <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-27/cfa-pass-rate-plummets-to-record-low-of-25-for-level-1-exam?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">25% of applicants</a> passed the Charter Financial Analyst Level I Exam administered in May, the lowest since testing began in 1963 and down from the 44% pass rate for the test administered in February. The CFA Institute said that the “stop-start” nature of candidates’ studies due to the pandemic could be to blame.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Abhorrent and insulting.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than 2,000 Activision Blizzard employees signed an <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-26/activision-blizzard-staff-sign-petition-supporting-labor-lawsuit?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open letter</a> Monday bashing the company’s response to a recent <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/22/california-sues-gaming-company-activision-blizzard?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lawsuit</a>, which alleged that female employees were routinely discriminated against. Employees are staging a walkout today to demand changes in the ways women and other marginalized groups are treated at the company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Who will pay to protect tech giants from rising seas? (<a href="https://apps.npr.org/sea-level-rise-silicon-valley/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a>)</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/influencer-marketing-spending-pass-3-billion-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tell Your Dad Being On Instagram is a Real Job
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/influencer-marketing-spending-pass-3-billion-year?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Makeup influencer takes selfie on a beach" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/kzrGfmOs3os4FcuJFo/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Makeup influencer takes selfie on a beach" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/kzrGfmOs3os4FcuJFo/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You haven’t lived until you’ve bought a Bluetooth keyboard from a TikTok influencer’s recommendation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if there’s any time to be hawking trendy electronics from your social account, it’s right now, because influencer marketing spending is expected to grow more than 30% this year to <a href="https://www.emarketer.com/content/us-influencer-spending-surpass-3-billion-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top $3 billion</a>, per eMarketer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>Marketers reduced influencer ad spend early in the pandemic, but with the economy roaring back and travel influencers able to do their yoga-pose-on-a-mountain thing once again, the sector is poised to grow fast—especially thanks to new trends like social commerce and short video.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Influencer marketing is still a relatively small line item for most companies. It will only make up a sliver of the $59 billion expected to be spent on social media advertising in 2021.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word Search: </strong>Of course this week's puzzle is Olympics-themed. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/27/word-search-olympic-figures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Go for gold here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Style and Substance</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every month, the WSJ stylebook editors compile a list of errors published in the newspaper. Can you spot the grammatical mistakes in the following sentences? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Many workers who furnished their home offices later in the pandemic say the key to avoiding buyer’s remorse is going slow. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mr. Boyer and his wife Elaine set up trusts for their five grandchildren with gifts of $25,000 each, an amount they plan to give annually for at least a decade.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The group has sought in recent months to present themselves as a responsible state actor to regional powers and the West.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When the last season ended and preparations for the next one started, teams were staring down a reality that none of them prepared for.</span></li>
</ol>

src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NjcvdXNhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn March, the US government provided an additional $300/week to unemployed workers through September to blunt the impact of the economic downturn. Many states chose to end those benefits this summer, arguing they were a major contributor to the widespread labor shortage.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDid cutting those benefits boost hiring? \u003c/strong\u003eEconomists are scrambling to figure it out, and yesterday we got a \u003ca href=\"https://gusto.com/company-news/hiring-trends-as-enhanced-unemployment-insurance-benefits-expire-evidence-from-high-frequency-small-business-data?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreliminary answer\u003c/a\u003e that’s just as nuanced as the question: Extra unemployment insurance (UI) didn’t impact overall job growth, but it did cause a reshuffling of the type of people who were working. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat comes from a report from the payroll processor Gusto, which compared hiring trends in the 20 states that cut the extra unemployment (UI) payments in June with those in states that kept them around for longer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe takeaways\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn states that ended extra UI early, hiring for adult workers 25 or older increased the week governors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003esaid\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e they were cutting benefits, but it returned to typical levels once the benefits actually expired.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt the same time, the hiring of teenagers 15–19 jumped in states that didn’t cut the extra benefits.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOverall, employment growth in states that ended enhanced UI early \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e states that are keeping it until September has been roughly equal. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does it mean?\u003c/strong\u003e Extra UI payments \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/07/27/unemployment-insurance-go-away/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplayed a role\u003c/a\u003e in keeping some adult workers from coming back to work. The spike in teen hiring in states with extra UI shows that when employers couldn’t find adults to hire, they brought on younger workers with less experience—and who may not qualify for unemployment.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe takeaway of the takeaways \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause overall employment growth didn’t change based on whether a state had cut off the extra benefits, “Ending unemployment insurance is not the silver bullet” to a speedier economic recovery, Gusto Economist Luke Pardue said. He suggested that alleviating childcare burdens and getting more people vaccinated were the keys to unlocking greater job growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable CEO Satya Nadella said the words “enterprise metaverse” on the earnings call and not even he knew what it meant. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAlphabet, \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle’s parent company, said ad revenue \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/27/alphabet-googl-earnings-q2-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 69%\u003c/a\u003e [redacted joke]. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSimone Biles, US Olympic gymnastics team member and the greatest gymnast of all time, pulled out of the team finals in Tokyo yesterday, saying she wasn't in the right state of mind and feared she'd \"do something dumb and get hurt.\" In a post-competition press conference, she \u003ca href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/simone-biles-naomi-osaka-mental-health-olympics_n_61001bdae4b00fa7af7c385b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewithdrawal\u003c/a\u003e from the French Open this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened:\u003c/strong\u003e After a rocky vault routine, the 24-year-old, four-time Olympic gold medalist left the floor, and teammate Jordan Chiles subbed in on the uneven bars. Team USA ultimately took silver.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn Monday, Biles \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CRxsq_kBZrP/?utm_source=ig_embed\u0026ig_rid=57417737-e4cc-4a93-a875-4f21c7ff8570\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Instagram that sometimes it feels like she has the “weight of the world” on her shoulders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Biles's decision is part of a larger trend of athletes, especially in this year’s Olympics, \u003ca href=\"https://time.com/6082203/tokyo-olympics-mental-health/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopening up\u003c/a\u003e about the emotional struggles that come with intense competition and scrutiny. This year’s Games mark the first time the Olympics introduced guidelines for athletes and coaches on how to screen for and address mental health concerns. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBiles said she wasn’t sure whether she’d compete in the
